channel.title: Stories from esquire.com - Digg
channel.description: Archive of the best esquire.com stories on Digg including articles, videos, and photos

item.title: I Sampled My Way Through The Wild World Of High-End Cannabis Products
item.description: If luxury THC granola, weed aperitifs and CBD pillows couldn't make me into a stoner, nothing can.

item.title: Why Americans Are Too Angry To Fix The American Dream
item.description: We cannot survive as a nation where ZIP code is destiny.

item.title: I Can't Answer My Daughter's Questions About COVID-19
item.description: A stay-at-home dad struggles to answer his daughter's questions during the Coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Thieves Stole A Vincent Van Gogh Painting Worth Millions Last Week. This Is What Happens Next
item.description: What do the criminals do with The "Parsonage Garden at Nuenen in Spring," and how could they get caught?

item.title: When Will There Be A Coronavirus Vaccine?
item.description: Twelve months? Eighteen months? Two years? Whatever happens, a vaccine will arrive later than we need, but sooner than ever before

item.title: Inside SportsCenter On The Day We Lost Sports
item.description: Empty parking lots, no highlights and three live shows a day: This is how ESPN's 40-year-old program is fighting through the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: A Second Joe Exotic Documentary Claims to Have New Information About Carole Baskin's Late Husband
item.description: An upcoming Investigation Discovery series says it will show "the investigation you didn't get to see" in Tiger King.

item.title: A New Episode Of 'Tiger King' Could Be On Its Way, According to Jeff Lowe
item.description: One of the subjects of Netflix's hit documentary series suggested that the streaming service is working on another installment.

item.title: Chris Evans Doesn't Like To Talk About Himself. But He Did. Sort Of
item.description: The actor formerly known as Cap has earned career freedom. But first, he just wants to hang out with his dog, Dodger.

item.title: Saff Saffery Discusses His Life After 'Tiger King' And Why He Left The Zoo Business Behind
item.description: Former GW Zoo manager Saff Saffrey, who got his arm ripped off by a tiger on "Tiger King," talks to Esquire about being misgendered in the series, what the Netflix documentary got right about Joe Exotic and what he's up to now.

item.title: Here Are 10 Documentaries To Watch After You've Seen Netflix's 'Tiger King'
item.description: These films and series will help quench your thirst for true stories that are stranger than fiction.

item.title: Inside One Man's Mission To Treat LA's Homeless For COVID-19
item.description: The homeless in America's cities are at high risk for COVID-19 — which, in turn, increases the risk for everyone. Brett Feldman is on the front lines trying to help.

item.title: A Coronavirus Timeline: How The World Will Change Over The Next 18 Months
item.description: "We'll see quite a marked increase in the birth rate. When you get bored with the telly, there's nothing else to do."

item.title: The Day The Coronavirus Came To Prison
item.description: In the days before he went into lockdown, John J. Lennon sent this dispatch on how Sing Sing was preparing for the inevitable arrival of COVID-19.

item.title: The Entirely-Possible Path To Pornhub Actually Winning An Oscar
item.description: As the adult streaming juggernaut Pornhub moves into original movies with Shakedown could it follow in the model of Netflix and HBO to become a real awards contender?
item.kicker: WE'LL KNOW IT WHEN WE SEE IT

item.title: Inside The Washington State Motel Converted Into A Coronavirus Quarantine
item.description: As COVID-19 spreads, King County in Washington State took an unprecedented step to quarantine and isolate Coronavirus patients to avoid overcrowding hospitals. Here's an inside look at the Econo Lodge.

item.title: How A Mysterious, Beloved Star Wars Character Could Finally Appear In Disney's Next Era
item.description: After petitions for Keanu Reeves to play the beloved character, fans think Revan might finally become part of official canon.

item.title: The Six Personality Types Any Group Of Coworkers Or Friends Needs
item.description: Every group needs a worrier, a shit-stirrer, a calendar-checker, a party animal, a "don't sweat it"-sayer and a stoner to be functioning and balanced.

item.title: The Bernie Sanders Youth Revolution Was Nowhere To Be Found On Super Tuesday
item.description: It may be time to admit that young people's support does not automatically translate to young people's votes.

item.title: The 'High Republic' Makes Me As Optimistic As I Have Ever Been About Star Wars
item.description: Disney's next era of the beloved sci-fi franchise finally frees us from the confines of the Skywalker saga.

item.title: Elon Musk, His Rocket, And The Grand Scheme That Tore Apart Boca Chica
item.description: SpaceX is dismantling a remote beach community at the southernmost end of Texas, one house at a time. Some residents took its money. Others refuse to leave. Still others are sticking around to see what happens.

item.title: How A Former Mechanic Became One Of America's Best Bread Wizards
item.description: The unlikely story of how Ryan Morgan, a former mechanic and now head of Sixteen Bricks in Cincinnati, became one of America's best bread makers.

item.title: 'You Haven't Given Up': How Prisoners Are Finding A Place For Personal Style On The Inside
item.description: In New York state prisons, a few accommodations for fashion have created a whole ecosystem of sartorial expression.

item.title: John Krasinski's Second Act Didn't Pick Up Where Jim Left Off. You Mad?
item.description: Ahead of his highly-anticipated A "Quiet Place Part II," the director discusses the politics of his work, an "Office" reunion, and Marvel movies.

item.title: Rob McElhenney Is Ready For His Next Quest
item.description: Fifteen years after creating a beloved FX sitcom, Rob McElhenney is onto his sophomore project, Apple TV+'s "Mythic Quest," where he's using the lessons he learned on "It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia" to navigate changes in comedy.
item.kicker: THE GANG GOES TO APPLE TV+

item.title: The Secret History Of Page Six
item.description: For more than four decades, Page Six has ruled the world of gossip about the famous and powerful. In an era when celebrities control the narrative and "power" is a dirty word, can it survive?

item.title: Photos Of Musicians Backstage In The 1970s
item.description: Behind the scenes of an iconic era of music history.

item.title: Macaulay Culkin Is Not Like You
item.description: "Home Alone" actor Macaulay Culkin discusses life today, his relationship with girlfriend Brenda Song, taking drugs and how he and his brother Kieran Culkin reacted to their sister's death.

item.title: The Story Of Huey Lewis Is Not A Tragedy
item.description: Suddenly, and without warning, the beloved pop star lost his ability to hear amplified music. Now, from his remote Montana ranch, he's on a search for answers.
item.kicker: 'IT WAS THE WORST NIGHT OF MY LIFE'

item.title: Stayin' Alive In Lambeau: How Fox Sports Pulls Off An NFL Playoffs Broadcast
item.description: Joe Buck, Troy Aikman, Erin Andrews and company produce a show for 35 million people. It's a delicate dance amid beautiful chaos.

item.title: 21 Hours With Alan Dershowitz — Inside Donald Trump's Lawyer Preparations For Congress
item.description: Over the course of one week, Tom Chiarella watched Donald Trump's TV-loving lawyer prepare for his biggest argument to date. He still can't make sense of it.

item.title: 'Fox & Friends' Brian Kilmeade Says John Bolton Book Leak Will Complicate Trump's Senate Coverup
item.description: Brian Kilmeade suggested John Bolton's book leak will complicate the effort to ram the Senate trial through without witnesses.

item.title: Inside America's First Weed Restaurant, Where You'll Be Paranoid For No Reason
item.description: The Cannabis Cafe is history-making. And boy is it a West Hollywood kind of trip.

item.title: The Original 'Star Wars IX' Script Has Allegedly Leaked. And It's Much Better Than 'The Rise of Skywalker'
item.description: Read Colin Trevorrow's vision for the finale of the saga, which is far more coherent than the movie J.J. Abrams made.

item.title: The 'Surviving R. Kelly' Producers Didn't Want To Make A Part Two. But There Were More Stories To Tell
item.description: Executive producers Jesse Daniels and Brie Miranda Bryant detail the challenges and fear of returning to the groundbreaking Lifetime docuseries Surviving R Kelly.

item.title: How Facebook Created The Bourbon Boom — And Ruined Bourbon
item.description: For better or for worse, Facebook's bourbon black markets completely changed the way we drank bourbon this decade.

item.title: The Best American Restaurants Of The Decade
item.description: When people look back on this arbitrary demarcation of years, these will be the 40 restaurants that bring time-specific memories flooding back.

item.title: How The Barbour Jacket Has Stayed A Must-Own For Over A Century
item.description: As it enters its 125th year of existence, Barbour looks ahead while keeping one foot planted firmly in the past.

item.title: Mdou Moctar: The Hendrix Of The Sahara
item.description: Mdou Moctar was never meant to play guitar. Despite the odds, the left-handed Tuareg guitarist managed to make a name for himself and one of the best rock albums of the year.

item.title: The True Story Behind The Greatest Rivalry In The History Of Men's Competitive Yoga
item.description: The rivalry between Jared McCann and Joseph Encina at the International Yoga Federation's 11th annual world championship was unlike any other.

item.title: Inside Joe Pesci's Star-Studded — And Underrated — Music Career
item.description: Joe Pesci, who is partly responsible for the founding of Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons, is dropping an album two days after the release of "The Irishman" that comes from a career-long association with music.

item.title: The Enduring, Intergalactic Cool Of Billy Dee Williams
item.description: As the legendary actor returns to Star Wars, he talks about his masculine and feminine sides, the legacy of Lando, and how after 82 years he's never lost his style.

item.title: 'Game Of Thrones' Season 8 Scripts Show Bran Actually Wasn't Totally Useless During The Battle Of Winterfell
item.description: The scripts show us exactly what Bran was doing during GoT's big battle in Season 8.

item.title: Trolls Are Stopping Spicer From Being Eliminated On Dancing With The Stars
item.description: Seven weeks and five elimination later and Sean Spicer is still on Dancing With the Stars?

item.title: Diplo's Western Look Was Supposed To Last For Just One Show. Now He's In It For The Long Haul
item.description: The label boss and mega-DJ dishes on his recent rugged closet overhaul.

item.title: New York Betting Laws Force Gamblers To Head To Eastern Jersey Every NFL Weekend
item.description: The federal ban on sports betting has been lifted, but some places (New Jersey) make it easier than others (New York). What's a sports fanatic living on the wrong side of the Hudson to do?

item.title: The Best Stephen King Adaptations, Ranked
item.description: Esquire runs down the 20 best films and shows from Stephen King with "Carrie," "It," "The Shining," "Castle Rock," and more.

item.title: 'One Grotesque Irony After Another': Inside The Rise And Fall Of Gawker 2.0
item.description: Last year, Bryan Goldberg revealed big plans for his relaunch of Gawker, then postponed it indefinitely while laying off the whole staff. Now, there's serious talk of reviving it yet again. Here's what happened behind the scenes.

item.title: HBO's 'Watchmen' Might Be The Most Challenging Series Premiere of All Time
item.description: Murder, white supremacist cults, masked cops, and raining squid — we walk through the series premiere of HBO's new 'Watchmen' show.

item.title: Ronan Farrow On The True Story Behind 'Catch And Kill'
item.description: From Hollywood heir to Hillary Clinton's State Department to failed cable news host to Pulitzer Prize winner, Ronan Farrow explains his path to 'Catch and Kill' and what comes next.
